meanings.definition: A way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination.
meanings.sent1: The scenic route through the mountains was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The GPS showed the fastest route to the airport.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally took a detour and ended up on a longer route.
meanings.sent4: Life's journey is like a winding route with unexpected turns.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map revealed a hidden route to the treasure.

meanings.definition: A fixed course or path for a journey.
meanings.sent1: The hiking route was well-marked with colorful signs.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck followed its designated route every day.
meanings.sent3: The marathon route passed by famous landmarks, keeping the runners motivated.
meanings.sent4: His career took an unconventional route, leading to great success.
meanings.sent5: The migratory birds followed the same route every year without fail.

meanings.definition: To send or direct along a specified course.
meanings.sent1: The dispatcher will route the package to the correct address.
meanings.sent2: Please route all inquiries to the customer service department.
meanings.sent3: The automated system will route your call to the next available agent.
meanings.sent4: She decided to route the email through a secure server for added protection.
meanings.sent5: The captain will route the ship around the storm to ensure safety.
